plugin.name: FitNesse Launcher Maven Plugin
plugin.description: Provides ability to launch FitNesse as a wiki server, or automatically run FitNesse tests as part of a standard integration-test / verify build. Allows configuration of FitNesse's classpath through plugin dependencies, and injects all Maven project properties as FitNesse variables, ( which can be overridden from the command line using '-D' ).

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Directory where reports will go.

parameter.name: reportsDir
parameter.description: This is where reports go.

mojo.description: Goal that provides summary report on FitNesse tests run with 'run-tests' goal. Intended to be bound to the 'verify' phase. Will fail the build if there are test failures.

parameter.name: createSymLink
parameter.description: fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin unpacks a fresh copy of FitNesse under /target; Only your project specific FitNesse tests need go under src/test/fitnesse. By setting 'createSymLink' to 'true', fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin will create a FitNesse SymLink directly to your test suite under src/test/fitnesse. This is most useful when developing tests in 'wiki' mode, as then you can directly scm commit your changes. If you prefer to copy-resources from src/test/fitnesse into /target/fitnesse, let 'createSymLink' be 'false'.

parameter.name: excludeOptionalDependencies
parameter.description:
Should fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin exclude optional transitive dependencies, when configured using <useProjectDependencies> ?
Note: This may result in duplicates or conflicts for transitive dependencies.
See Issue #27.
Defaults to true.
@Deprecated

parameter.name: localRepository
parameter.description: Location of the local repository.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: Maven project, to be injected by Maven itself.

parameter.name: remoteArtifactRepositories
parameter.description: List of Remote Repositories used by the resolver

parameter.name: reportsDir
parameter.description: This is where reports go.

parameter.name: resultsDir
parameter.description: This is where test results go.

parameter.name: session
parameter.description: The Maven Session Object

parameter.name: summaryFile
parameter.description: The summary file to write integration test results to.

mojo.description: Goal that launches FitNesse tests using fitnesse.junit.TestHelper. Intended to be bound to the 'integration-test' phase.

parameter.name: createSymLink
parameter.description: fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin unpacks a fresh copy of FitNesse under /target; Only your project specific FitNesse tests need go under src/test/fitnesse. By setting 'createSymLink' to 'true', fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin will create a FitNesse SymLink directly to your test suite under src/test/fitnesse. This is most useful when developing tests in 'wiki' mode, as then you can directly scm commit your changes. If you prefer to copy-resources from src/test/fitnesse into /target/fitnesse, let 'createSymLink' be 'false'.

mojo.description: Cleanup debris after FitNesse runs. See {@link fitnesse.responders.run.formatters.PageInProgressFormatter} and {@link fitnesse.slim.test.TestsInProgress}, wherein they have hard-coded the directory where they track test progress.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: Maven project, to be injected by Maven itself.

parameter.name: session
parameter.description: The Maven Session Object

mojo.description: Goal that launches FitNesse as a wiki server. Useful for manually running / developing / debugging FitNesse tests. Once launched, just visit http://localhost:<port>/<suite>. Use the 'shutdown' goal (from a different command line), or Ctrl+C to shutdown, or send GET to http://localhost:<port>/?responder=shutdown.

parameter.name: createSymLink
parameter.description: fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin unpacks a fresh copy of FitNesse under /target; Only your project specific FitNesse tests need go under src/test/fitnesse. By setting 'createSymLink' to 'true', fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin will create a FitNesse SymLink directly to your test suite under src/test/fitnesse. This is most useful when developing tests in 'wiki' mode, as then you can directly scm commit your changes. If you prefer to copy-resources from src/test/fitnesse into /target/fitnesse, let 'createSymLink' be 'false'.

parameter.name: excludeOptionalDependencies
parameter.description:
Should fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin exclude optional transitive dependencies, when configured using <useProjectDependencies> ?
Note: This may result in duplicates or conflicts for transitive dependencies.
See Issue #27.
Defaults to true.
@Deprecated

parameter.description: Location of the local repository.

mojo.description: Goal that shuts down FitNesse. This is done by sending GET to http://localhost:<port>/?responder=shutdown.

parameter.name: resultsDir
parameter.description: This is where test results go.

mojo.description: This Mojo is devoted simply to fetching and unpacking FitNesse into a correct working directory structure, and making sure everything is cleanly setup for running FitNesse.

parameter.name: alwaysUnpackFitnesse
parameter.description: If set, fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin will always freshly unpack the FitNesse jar, as part of setting up a clean fitnesse environment.

parameter.name: deletePluginsProperties
parameter.description: If set, fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin will delete any existing plugins.properties file as part of setting up a clean fitnesse environment. If you need to retain the plugin.properties file, set this property to false.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: Maven project, to be injected by Maven itself.

parameter.name: session
parameter.description: The Maven Session Object
